partintro.title: Introduction
partintro.para: This is technical reference documentation for the FO table-processing templates in the DocBook XSL Stylesheets.
This is not intended to be user documentation. It is provided for developers writing customization layers for the stylesheets.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate an XSL FO table column width specification from a CALS table column width specification.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CALS expresses table column widths in the following basic forms:

listitem.para: 99.99, a fixed length specifier without any units.

refsect1.para: The CALS units are points (pt), picas (pi), centimeters (cm), millimeters (mm), and inches (in). These are the same units as XSL, except that XSL abbreviates picas "pc" instead of "pi". If a length specifier has no units, the CALS default unit (pt) is assumed.
Relative length specifiers are represented in XSL with the proportional-column-width() function.
